monogr.title: Pasquils passe, and passeth not : Set downe in three pees. His passe, precession, and prognostication
monogr.author: Breton, Nicholas

div.head: Pasquill to Morphorius.
div.p: MOrphorius, I promised thee a Passe, which heere I haue sent thee, hoping in the like kindnesse ere long to heare from thee: in the meane time, let mee tell thee, that for our parts, we haue little ioy to looke for in this worlde: fooles doe not vnderstand vs, and knaues do but abuse vs, the wealthy loue vs not, and the poore can do vs no good: honesty is ill for thriuing; and yet the wisedome of the world being foolishnesse before God, I know not what to say: but for that the time of our life is short in this worlde; let vs leaue vanitie, and fall to some vertuous courses and yet, because I will not at this time trouble thee too much with the Scripture, I will leaue thee to reade what I haue scribbled: and so end in some haste.
